title.text: Spell Checking Techniques for Replacement of Unknown Words and Data Cleaning for Haitian Creole SMS Translation

abstractContent.text: We report results on translation of SMS messages from Haitian Creole to English.

entities.text: translation of SMS messages from Haitian Creole

abstractContent.text: We show improvements by applying spell checking techniques to unknown words and creating a lattice with the best known spelling equivalents.
We also used a small cleaned corpus to train a cleaning model that we applied to the noisy corpora.

introductionContent.text: In this paper we report results on the WMT 2011 featured shared task on translation of SMS messages from Haitian Creole into English, which featured a number of challenges.

entities.text: translation of SMS messages from Haitian Creole

introductionContent.text: The in-domain data available is small and noisy, with a lot of non-standard language.
Furthermore, Haitian Creole is a low resource language, for which there are few language technology tools and corpora available.

Our main focus has been to make the best possible use of the available training data through different ways of cleaning the data, and by replacing unknown words in the test data by plausible spelling equivalents.
We have also investigated effects of different ways to combine the available data in translation and language models.
